column5: I'm busy this weekend, but I've put a link to this on my facebook page. You should get a facebook link thingy on the web site, people would just need to click on it to add it to their page. You could even start a 'Fishing for Tyler'  facebook page as well, couldn't hurt!

I had a chance to get a website running specifically for the Fishing for Tyler Event. I've donated my time, the domain name as well as hosting for as long as the event occurs. It contained as much info as I could quicky gather up, I borrowed some photos from past events.  This year I will be attending the event again and after the prizes are given out I will be doing a LIVE auction to Fundraise for the Frenches. I already have some stuff coming from Big Jim, Bass Pro, Dave Mercer, Pete Maina, Myself, Art, Spiel and Real Pro Fishing as well. (I've likely missed some people....)  I am really hoping to make this years event a HUGE success so I am calling on everyone to help me out. If you have anything for the prize table please email Elisa at [email protected].  If you have anything (over $100.00 in value) that you think would make a good Auction Item, please PM or email me.  Here's a link to the new site:
You always come through, TJ.
Great site TJ! I really hope I can make the event this year!!
Great stuff boss.. this younger crowd is gonna ask if you take debit cards though.. none of them carry more than $5 cash!! lol
LOL.. sorry only gold coins.. I will take a cheque though.. lol.. god forbid ya bounce it!!!
That logo is copyrighted boss.....only a dollar a click to you though.....
Kudos to you for taking the time to do this boss  You deserve a special thanks and round of applause  I'll look around see what I can find
Great job TJ, maybe pin this to the top?  Rob C
Well done as always T.J. Thanks for the time and effort for such a worthy cause.   Art
Well Done Boss...You da greatest...
Great Job T.J.  I am hoping to make it this year
Great job T J, see ya there
Hi T.J. I'm sure Off The Dock can throw in a few shirts if you'd like! Let us know!

Hey T.J. Site looks great only sorry I won't be there to help out but I am sure that others will fill in, Just like Vince said he will look after the cooking but I am sure he will need help, you always do...   Only to bad you don't have prior pics to put up.
Great looking site T.J., I'm hoping to attend this year.  Do you know if the town of Innisfil will waive the parking fee for those attending?  I'd rather give the additional $ to this instead.
Great looking site Tj as always this site has come through.
X 2.  I'd donate twice the amount of the parking fee if that were the case.
If anyone bounces a cheque, I'll bounce them !!!  Oooops ! Did I say that out loud ?
He sure does. I don't know how we could do this without T.J.!
Yes, the Town of Innisfil has waived the parking fee again this year.
Took me some time to find the key,but will be there this Saturday with my youngest boy and a friend ,so I was told.  I have 4,"maybe more if i can find the  time", spud bars for the prize table.

Can't wait for the Tyler derby. We've had so much fun the last few it's become the highlight of our hardwater season. Going to move the hut this week to try and get on some fish as it's been slow were we are. Only 7 or so whitefish a few herring a bunch of perch and NO trout so far this year were it is. (87 FOW)  Hoping for a great turnout. BEST OF LUCK TO YOU ALL.

Really looking forward to this as well, just puttin' the fixins on my pop up, broke 2 hubs so far (Clam replaced).  I think I've finally figured it out now lol.  Hopefully others might be able to steer us in the right direction when we're there.  Never fished from IBP and don't have a flasher.

7th Annual Ice Fishing/BBQ Fundraiser Saturday, February 26, 2011 Innisfil Beach Park Boat Launch Registration: 6 a.m. to 12:30 p.m., last fish measured at 1 p.m., prizes to follow.  Cost: 16 years of age and over – $10 minimum donation, kids free – donations appreciated  * A fishing license is required for those between 18 and 65 years of age.*  Enjoy a BBQ lunch cooked on site Cost: Donation  Prizes awarded for largest fish caught in various categories; lucky draw following!  *All monies raised will help Tyler’s parents pay for the extensive therapies that he requires, including Intensive Behavioral Intervention (IBI), Speech and Language Therapy, and Occupational Therapy.* Directions: Hwy 400 or Yonge St. to the 8th line (Innisfil Beach Rd.), east on Innisfil Beach Rd, to the end, turn left into the park, follow the road to the right, past the snack bar to the boat launch. Please park in the parking lots on the left side before boat launch. For more information please email [email protected] or call 705-436-3607
Excellent job T.J.! My wife works with autistic children in the TDSB system, the work is challenging but very rewarding.
